page.title: 01Landscape
page.content: Shifnal,with its population of 6,272 (1981),is in the east of Shropshire close to the Staffordshire border.The tributary of the River Severn,the Worfe ,flows through Shifnal and the surrounding agricultural plain. Shifnal was given to Roger de Montgomery by William the Conqueror. The village became a busy little town in coaching days with timber framed buildings.This part of Shropshire became industrialised with the nearby revolution in the iron industry ,and Shifnal was a chain manufacturing centre . Extending from the western boundary of Shifnal is the growing town of Telford with an ultimate population of 220,000.The M54 now links the new town with the M6.Shifnal has a main line station,and is not far from the city of Birmingham.
